markdown.markdown: [reservatoriosBR](https://brunomioto.github.io/reservatoriosBR/) downloads data from **Brazilian reservoirs** from the SAR-ANA and ONS platforms and organizes it into a structure for use in R! I am currently looking for volunteers to test the functions and data. If you can, [get in touch](mailto:bhmstabile@gmail.com)! If you use it in any work, cite it or let me know! I wonder how this package can help! We can use this historical data to do analysis and graphing. The Affluence (mÂ³/s), for example, measures the amount of water that arrives at the reservoirs. You can install it running: ```{r, eval=FALSE} if(!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE)){ install.packages("remotes") } remotes::install_github("brunomioto/reservatoriosBR") ``` ## ggimprensa [ggimprensa](https://brunomioto.github.io/ggimprensa/) brings themes from the main **Brazilian newspapers** for ggplot2. This package was inspired by the [ggthemes](https://github.com/jrnold/ggthemes) package. The goal of this package is to help users to create more beautiful graphics in an easy and fast way. You can install it running: ```{r, eval=FALSE} if(!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE)){ install.packages("remotes") } remotes::install_github("brunomioto/ggimprensa") ``` ::: {layout-ncol="3"} ![G1 theme](figures/README-example_g1.png) ![Nexo theme](figures/README-example_nexo.png) ![Poder 360 theme](figures/README-example-poder360.png) ::: ## More packages soon...
